column9: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Unique Users)
column10: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through unpaid distribution. (Unique Users)
column11: Lifetime: The number of people who had your Page's post enter their screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Unique Users)
column12: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen. Posts include statuses, photos, links, videos and more. (Total Count)
column13: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's posts entered a person's screen through unpaid distribution. (Total Count)
column14: Lifetime: The number of times your Page's post entered a person's screen through paid distribution such as an ad. (Total Count)
column15: Lifetime: The number of unique people who engaged in certain ways with your Page post, for example by commenting on, liking, sharing, or clicking upon particular elements of the post. (Unique Users)
column16: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting that clicked anywhere in your post on News Feed. (Unique Users)
column17: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in your post on News Feed from the user that matched the audience targeting on it. (Total Count)
column18: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post. (Unique Users)
column19: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post. (Total Count)
column20: Lifetime: The number of impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column21: Lifetime: The number of people who saw your Page post because they've liked your Page (Unique Users)
column22: Lifetime: The number of paid impressions of your Page post to people who have liked your Page. (Total Count)
column23: Lifetime: The number of people who like your Page and who saw your Page post in an ad or sponsored story. (Unique Users)
column24: Lifetime: The number of people who have liked your Page and clicked anywhere in your posts. (Unique Users)
column25: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column26: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column27: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column28: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed to 95% of its length after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column29: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column30: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed for more than 3 seconds without any paid promotion. (Total Count)
column31: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Unique Users)
column32: Lifetime: Number of times your video was viewed more than 3 seconds after paid promotion. (Total Count)
column33: Lifetime: Average time video viewed (Total Count)
column34: Lifetime: Length of a video post (Total Count)
column35: Lifetime: The number of unique people who created a story about your Page post by interacting with it. (Unique Users)
column38: Lifetime: The number of stories created about your Page post, by action type. (Total Count)
column41: Lifetime: The number of people who matched the audience targeting on the post that clicked anywhere in the post on News Feed, by type. (Unique Users)
column45: Lifetime: The number of clicks anywhere in the post on News Feed from users that matched the audience targeting on the post, by type. (Total Count)
column49: Lifetime: The number of times people have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Total Count)
column50: Lifetime: The number of people who have given negative feedback to your post, by type. (Unique Users)

column3:
Close out #BlackHistoryMonth by diving into the creative mind of OTV - Open Television's first Executive Director and self-proclaimed International Pop Star, Eli Micky via ReelChicago.com and Reel360.com! 

Not only do they share some exciting plans for OTV in 2020 they also share some personal gems like how they found their way at the helm of intersectional TV production, what they've been cooking up in South Africa, and a very odd job they worked during university. 

#weareotv

#OTVPlayback has returned with a blackity black vengeance. #OTVPlayback is a celebration of our previous cycle, uplifting series and pilots that have a home on weareo.tv. We're closing out #BlackHistoryMonth celebrating some of our works featuring black stories and creators. 

First up is Searching for Isabelle created by our very own Head of Production Stephanie Jeter. AND if you see our girl say congrats because she just made the ReelChicago.com and Reel360.com Black List! 

You can find Searching for Isabelle at weareo.tv/presents. 

While being held captive, Isabelle discovers a mysterious ability to project herself to the outside world. When she appears to her friends in a desperate appeal for help, they work together to try and find her - but time is running out.

OTV's first head of production and current head of the OTV Studio Stephanie Jeter drops knowledge in this interview. Congrats Stephanie! 

"A deep passion for every project I work on drives me to the finish line, always, but I consider every project a preparation to tell my family’s story with great craftmanship. So, in short, I’m motivated by the idea of making my ancestors proud and to leave the imprint of their legacy on American cinema."

It's official! #BraveFutures Berlin is LIVE. Best of luck to all of the teams. We can't wait to meet and screen all of your work at Kino Moviemento Feb 25+26!  

Tickets are now on sale. RSVP to day: http://bit.ly/39nOKWv

EXTENDED DEADLINE: FEBRUARY 17

Join our 2nd annual class of OTV Fellows! Fellows will receive a stipend of $6,000-8,000 to develop a pitch for an original television series or film as they take courses in the new OTV Study Hall. These projects will be exhibited during our second annual OTV x Sundance: Emerging Storytellers of Chicago initiative taking place in August 2020. Applications are open till Monday! 

Visit weareo.tv/otv-fellows for more details!

Have you seen us in the latest issue of Siegessäule? 

Check us out and learn more about #BraveFutures in Berlin! Deadline to register has been extended to tonight, Feb 13 23:59! Don't miss out on a chance to win €1000+ in prizes, a distribution deal with an Emmy-nominated platform and more!  

Register for #BraveFuturesFilmRace here: http://bit.ly/bravefuturesberlin

In the year of 20plenty, we’re stopping to smell all of the roses🌹 we’re also welcoming back Chris Walker and Jenna Anast They’ll be returning to OTV as Head of Exhibition and Head of Community for Cycle 5, respectively. In addition to expanding OTV at a global level, we have big plans to welcome our fifth year of building community and creating a platform for intersectional artists to create brave and unapologetic stories in Chicago. Keep your eyes peeled for all of the magic Chris and Jenna plan to bring to these exciting new roles at a local level.
•
The Head of Exhibition is a position newly created to unleash the programming potential of OTV- Open Television, supporting and augmenting its diverse exhibition strategy and innovative educational offerings. As Head of Exhibition, Chris will build upon OTV’s commitment to providing a space to amplify intersectional narratives, this position will help the organization further evolve by implementing innovative, thought-provoking exhibitions (both online and offline) and programs related to the platform’s revolving catalogue, limited and temporary releases and topical issues and initiatives of interest to the OTV community.
•
As Head of Community, Jenna will be responsible for conceptualizing, developing and facilitating the implementation of projects and initiatives related to our commitment to community in Chicago. This includes being a valued neighbor and resource in the intersectional communities that we serve while also upholding OTV’s community agreements, mission and vision.
•
Don’t forget: we still are looking to contract a visual designer with a passion for video editing and creative direction and social marketing. Spread the word. Tell a friend. Deadline to apply is Feb 28. Apply at www.weareo.tv/build ✨

Thanks iHeartBerlin.de for spreading the word about the #BraveFuturesFilmRace coming to Berlin this month 🎥 

Registration closes Wednesday, Feb 12. Film race takes place Feb 15-17: http://bit.ly/bravefuturesberlin 

Screenings kick-off Feb 25-26 at Kino Moviemento!

Please help us send some Yonce claps to OTV's first Development Officer, Sarah Minnie �!

Sarah Minne will be joining the OTV fam as the first-ever Development Officer where she will work closely with Aymar and Elijah on the roll-out of OTV Fellows + OTV Study Hall program as well as assist with the management of our full slate of programs for cycle 5 and beyond.

Sarah is a Creative Producer/Curator/Director born and raised in Chicago, IL. She has made it a priority to uplift and motivate; both on set with her crew/cast and by inspiring students to actively pursue their dreams. Sarah is the Founder and Executive Producer of Minnie Productions, a boutique production house. She has produced a number of digital mediums such as: pilots, web series, music videos, a feature film, short narratives, corporate spots, blog posts and more.

Drop some love below and spread the word that we’re now looking for a visual designer that will help bring our concepts and campaigns to life!! Deadline to apply is Feb 29th. 💫💫 more details here: www.weareo.tv/build

We're building our tribe for Cylcle 5. Please join us in giving a warm and intentional welcome to Rebba Amaris, OTV's first Activation Officer. 
- 
Rebba will be joining the OTV squad as the first-ever, Activation Officer where she will be working intimately with Eli Micky to roll-out a myriad of social marketing initiatives (online and offline) and campaigns such as the OTV App Launch, our five year anniversary campaign and some other super top-secret ish that we can't talk about just yet!
- 
Rebba Amaris is a Chicago-based writer and educator living in historic Hyde Park. Rebba believes the black-radical imagination is expansive and varied. In her independent praxis as an emerging-queer video artist seeking imaginative self-determination, Rebba writes from a dissenting space of provocation that questions harmonious narratives of a colorblind present. Her work interrogates the intersections of collective & individual healing, as she navigates her position within post-modernity as an experimental artist in play & writer by medium. She graduated from the University of Chicago (MA ’15) and Rice University (BA, ’12). As a practice-led researcher in conversation with the unquantifiable— she hopes to articulate how healing and destructive salons transcend digital vs analog binaries. 
- 
Drop some love below and help spread the word that we’re looking for a visual designer that will help bring our concepts and campaigns to life!! Deadline to apply is Feb 29th. 💫💫 more details here: www.weareo.tv/build
